name: Double-Fried Pork Belly with Pickled Mustard Greens and Chili Oil
recipeIngredients: 2 cups pickling liquid (vinegar, sugar, salt, chili oil)
recipeInstructions: Step 1: Cure the pork belly with a mixture of salt, sugar, and five-spice powder for 24 hours.
Step 2: Rinse the pork belly under cold water and pat dry.
Step 3: Double-fry the pork belly by first deep-frying it at 160°C (320°F) for 10 minutes, then finishing it in a pan with vegetable oil at 200°C (400°F) for an additional 5-7 minutes.
Step 4: Prepare the pickling liquid and let the mustard greens soak for at least 30 minutes.
Step 5: Slice the pork belly into thin strips and serve with the pickled mustard greens, chili oil, garlic, and soy sauce.
description: A Sichuan-inspired dish that combines crispy pork belly with tangy pickled mustard greens and spicy chili oil. This recipe is a celebration of bold flavors and textures.
